abstract.text: A view controller that provides dynamic content to the standard sticker browser.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: to present the standard sticker browser. This browser provides drag-and-drop functionality. The user can press and hold a sticker to peel it from the browser, then drag the sticker to any balloon in the transcript. The user can also tap stickers to add them to the Messages app’s input field.
By default, the sticker browser view controller acts as the data source for its
property). This lets you dynamically change the list of stickers at runtime. You can also customize the size of the stickers inside the browser.

content.text: Setting the Sticker Browser as Your Root View

inlineContent.text: To use the sticker browser view controller as your extension’s root view, perform the following steps:
Create a custom subclass of the
class. For more information, see the subclassing notes.
In Interface Builder, add a container view to your extension’s initial scene and pin it to fill the root view as desired. For more information on setting up a container view, see
In the Identity inspector, set the embedded view controller’s class to your custom

instance as the extension’s root view controller, this approach ensures that the root view controller can respond to important messages from the system, while the contained sticker browser view controller focuses on managing your stickers.
By default, this controller sets itself as its sticker browser view’s data source. You must either provide another data source, or implement both

abstract.text: Create app extensions that allow users to send text, stickers, media files, and interactive messages.
The principal view controller for iMessage apps.
A browser view that displays a dynamically generated list of stickers.
A view controller that provides dynamic content to the standard sticker browser.
Creates a new sticker browser view controller with stickers of the provided size.
The sticker browser view managed by this controller.
A constant that indicates the size of the stickers.
The protocol for dynamically providing stickers to a browser view.
Asks the data source for the number of stickers that the browser will display.
Asks the data source for the sticker object that the browser will display at the provided index.
The size of the stickers in the browser view.
A view for displaying a sticker.
Enable your Sticker pack or iMessage app in the media context.

abstract.text: Drag and drop your sticker pack into the Stickers asset catalog to let people access your stickers from Messages.

abstract.text: An object that manages a view hierarchy for your UIKit app.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
The interface an app extension uses to respond to a request from a host app.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A protocol that an object adopts to create a bar object in your app.
An interface that provides a source for shareable content to fulfill user requests to share current content.
A protocol that a class must adopt to allow appearance customization using the [`UIAppearance`](doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIAppearance) API.
A set of methods for adapting the contents of your view controllers to size and trait changes.
A set of methods that define the focus behavior for a branch of the view hierarchy.
The interface that determines whether a responder object supports paste configuration.
A set of standard methods that apps can adopt to support editing.
Methods for adding objects to your state restoration archives.
A set of methods that makes the iOS interface environment available to your app.
The protocol you adopt to restore an object’s state from a user activity.
A type that calls your code in reaction to changes in the trait environment.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
